verses.text: Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; The gate of the inner court that looketh toward the east shall be shut the six working days ; but on the sabbath it shall be opened , and in the day of the new moon it shall be opened.

And the prince shall enter by the way of the porch of \add that\add* gate without , and shall stand by the post of the gate , and the priests shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings , and he shall worship at the threshold of the gate : then he shall go forth ; but the gate shall not be shut until the evening.
Likewise the people of the land shall worship at the door of this gate before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in the sabbaths and in the new moons.
And the burnt offering that the prince shall offer unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in the sabbath day \add shall be\add* six lambs without blemish , and a ram without blemish.

And the meat offering \add shall be\add* an ephah for a ram , and the meat offering for the lambs as he shall be able to give , and an hin of oil to an ephah.\f + \fr 46.5 \ft as he…: Heb. the gift of his hand\f*
And in the day of the new moon \add it shall be\add* a young bullock without blemish , and six lambs , and a ram : they shall be without blemish.
And he shall prepare a meat offering , an ephah for a bullock , and an ephah for a ram , and for the lambs according as his hand shall attain unto, and an hin of oil to an ephah.
And when the prince shall enter , he shall go in by the way of the porch of \add that\add* gate , and he shall go forth by the way thereof. \p

¶ But when the people of the land shall come before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* in the solemn feasts , he that entereth in by the way of the north gate to worship shall go out by the way of the south gate ; and he that entereth by the way of the south gate shall go forth by the way of the north gate : he shall not return by the way of the gate whereby he came in , but shall go forth over against it.
And the prince in the midst of them, when they go in , shall go in ; and when they go forth , shall go forth.
And in the feasts and in the solemnities the meat offering shall be an ephah to a bullock , and an ephah to a ram , and to the lambs as he is able to give , and an hin of oil to an ephah.

Now when the prince shall prepare a voluntary burnt offering or peace offerings voluntarily unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, \add one\add* shall then open him the gate that looketh toward the east , and he shall prepare his burnt offering and his peace offerings , as he did on the sabbath day : then he shall go forth ; and after his going forth \add one\add* shall shut the gate.

Thou shalt daily prepare a burnt offering unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add of\add* a lamb of the first year without blemish : thou shalt prepare it every morning.\f + \fr 46.13 \ft of the…: Heb. a son of his year\f*\f + \fr 46.13 \ft every…: Heb. morning by morning\f*

And thou shalt prepare a meat offering for it every morning , the sixth part of an ephah , and the third part of an hin of oil , to temper with the fine flour ; a meat offering continually by a perpetual ordinance unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
Thus shall they prepare the lamb , and the meat offering , and the oil , every morning \add for\add* a continual burnt offering. \p

¶ Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; If the prince give a gift unto any of his sons , the inheritance thereof shall be his sons’ ; it \add shall be\add* their possession by inheritance.
But if he give a gift of his inheritance to one of his servants , then it shall be his to the year of liberty ; after it shall return to the prince : but his inheritance shall be his sons’ for them.

Moreover the prince shall not take of the people’s inheritance by oppression , to thrust them out of their possession ; \add but\add* he shall give his sons inheritance out of his own possession : that my people be not scattered every man from his possession. \p

¶ After he brought me through the entry , which \add was\add* at the side of the gate , into the holy chambers of the priests , which looked toward the north : and, behold, there \add was\add* a place on the two sides westward.

Then said he unto me, This \add is\add* the place where the priests shall boil the trespass offering and the sin offering , where they shall bake the meat offering ; that they bear \add them\add* not out into the utter court , to sanctify the people.

Then he brought me forth into the utter court , and caused me to pass by the four corners of the court ; and, behold, in every corner of the court \add there was\add* a court.\f + \fr 46.21 \ft in every…: Heb. a court in a corner of a court, and a court in a corner of a court\f*

In the four corners of the court \add there were\add* courts joined of forty \add cubits\add* long and thirty broad : these four corners \add were\add* of one measure.\f + \fr 46.22 \ft joined: or, made with chimneys\f*\f + \fr 46.22 \ft corners were…: Heb. cornered, etc\f*
And \add there was\add* a row \add of building\add* round about in them, round about them four , and \add it was\add* made with boiling places under the rows round about.
Then said he unto me, These \add are\add* the places of them that boil , where the ministers of the house shall boil the sacrifice of the people.
